name: Balancing Player Classes
description:
Bob is creating a game!

**BUT**, it has some balancing issues in its class system. Bob wants to encourage players to use a variety of classes rather than sticking to one, so, in order to combat this, he will apply a modifier to all the class's stats.

All the classes (and their stats) will be in the `classes` variable.

The stats should be multiplied like: `(modifier * ([sum of all players] - [player count])) / [sum of all players]`

The return value should be a table that contains the modified `classes` value. *THERE WILL BE NO INVALID INPUT!*

*EXAMPLES:*

```
classes = {["knight"]={10,0},["shielder"]={0,10}} -> you can access these by classes["NAME_OF_CLASS"]
players = {["knight"]=10,["shielder"]=5}
modifier = 3

balance.balanceClasses(classes, players, modifier) -> result={["knight"]={10,0},["shielder"]={0,20}}
```

*here is how it works:*

The knight class has 10 players using it currently, with the multiplier being (3 * (15 - 10)) / 15, simplifying to 1. The shielder class has 5 players using it currently, with the multiplier being (3 * (15 - 5)) / 15, simplifying to 2. After these calculations, we should multiply the stats of the knight class by 1, and shielder class by 2. Use `math.floor()` to turn it into an integer.
